div.p: Yours of the 22 has been recd and relieved me much on Annies account I hope she was well enough to go home with Mrs McRoberts as a change would do her good if the weather is not too cool for must have been pretty hard reen to accomodate Mrs. McRoberts comfortabley as our beds are none of the best I think you had better get a spring for Hatties bed I am sorry she suffers with her head but she had better go to school as long as she can not going in very bad weather I do not think study can hurt hur and exercise will do her good if she does not walk so fast as to our exert and exhaust herself tell her to be careful about this last

I have met several persons here whom I knew as boys - one of them a son of Capt Buna whom you must have known in Ky but he was a great friend to Mr Brown and to me. I am to dine today with him he resides in town and is a Merchant, another is Col W Taylor son inalw to Genl Hamilton and a sort of a cousin whom I knew well as a boy in Richmond in fact I am meeting old acquaintances almost daily. hit has but little time to visit having to be in the office from 9 to 4 every day. I do not yet know if my present occupation will pay as well as that of last winter but hope I should find out some way of making money as living is much higher than it was I have been paying $2 per day but in a day or two will have a room fixed up and the
wll not spend more than $1,25 per day - I am in hopes soon of having some extra work after night as I get very lonesome life bedtime. god bless you all my dear ones, kiss all for me
